lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's practice passing multiple React components as children.

Complete the code to pass Banner and TextBox as children to the Panel component.

Make sure to pick <Panel> followed by <Banner /> and then <TextBox />, </Panel>.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is a benefit of passing content using the children prop in a React component?

It allows for nesting multiple components or HTML elements within a componentIt allows changing component stateIt disables React-specific syntaxIt improves component security by default

It allows for nesting multiple components or HTML elements within a component.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Pass the message handleClick to the Child component as a property called onButtonClick.

Make sure to pick onButtonClick followed by = and then {, handleClick, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which statement is true about passing functions as props in React?

Functions can be passed to child components in the same way as other data typesFunctions cannot be passed to child components as propsFunctions are automatically executed when passed as propsFunctions can be passed only as strings to child components

Functions can be passed to child components in the same way as other data types.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use props to pass a favorite character to components.

Make sure to pick character, followed by =, and finally "Harry Potter".

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's props drilling?

Passing data through multiple componentsStoring data globallyUpdating state in childrenAvoiding props entirely

Passing data through multiple components.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to pass modified props to the child InfoDisplay.

Make sure to pick props followed by . and then name, ., toUpperCase, (, ).

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set up the DynamicGreeting component so it accepts children and renders them.

Make sure to pick { followed by children and then }, <h2>, {, children, }, </h2>.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What will be the result of passing children in the following code?

The text "Hi there!" will be displayed inside a dialog containerThe application will crash because children is not definedThe dialog component will show no contentThe text will not render because it needs to be a component

The text "Hi there!" will be displayed inside a dialog container.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to pass the given function to the child component.

Make sure to type updateMessage.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens if you directly assign onClick={props.update} instead of wrapping it inside an arrow function?

The function will execute immediately during renderingThe function will not be called at allIt will wait for the button click to executeThe event will not attach properly to the button

The function will execute immediately during rendering.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Pass a character quote from Parent through Child to Display.

Make sure to pick quote, followed by characterQuote, and finally quote.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Pass the new title string to the BookInfo component.

Make sure to type title.
